post.body: I wouldn't doubt it.
I turned off the notifications. There wasn't any SPAM to my Twitter account at all. Just messages on my cell.
I did but haven't found anyone but a T-Mobile vendor.
they were from a wide variety of users. Not getting much help from T-Mobile's customer service.
I'm working on it!
Reading the Ad Contrarian and Seth Godin gives an excellent balance.
2009 will be an interesting year for ad agencies who haven't been participating in social media
you are very welcome.
hope you have a great holiday as well.
it is indeed. A paradigm shift in the way small and midsize agencies acquire new business accelerated by SM and the economy
thanks.
what web hosting service do you use?
Problogger had a good post on the transfer. I've just been putting it off.
very much appreciated.
Anyone else having problems with T-Mobile and Twitter?
Top 25 Reasons Why Ad Agencies Should Start a Blog http://twurl.nl/5lopp5
T-Mobile customer service not customer friendly. Still discussions going on for the past hour. Evidently they are fans of social media.
T-Mobile is not in violation of any agreement by not providing service to Twitter. T-Mobile regrets any inconvenience
Agency New Business Impacted by “The Perfect Storm” http://tinyurl.com/5wl8k7
T-Mobile rep is of course blaming it all on Twitter. Will forgive the $600 charges if I upgrade my T-Mobile account.
Ad Agency New Business Leads From a Blog? http://tinyurl.com/6pzdnu
Warning: T-Mobile is charging my account $600 for 3,200 spammed Twitter text messages even though they were unopened.
Has anyone else been spammed with SMS messages from Twitter? I had 3,200 on my cell yesterday that T Mobile is charging for.
